page.title: 02SOUTH DOWNS LAND COVER
page.content: From the crumbling hill fort of ancient man,Cissbury Ring looks down across the hummocks of their flint mines and strip lychets to the intensively cultivated patchwork created by modern man. The Downs have lost their natural cover and now echo to the sound of powerful and expensive machinery cultivating and processing crops of grain,oil seed rape,hay and grass for animal supplementary fodder. Seismic devices clutch the ground,recording for signs of oil,the black gold of the 1980's.The cries of football,hockey and cricket supporters fill the air of the more level areas. Golfers tramp the twin courses of Hill Barn and Worthing Golf Clubs,among the finest in Southern England.
